intro: Kosteletzkya adenosiphon, commonly known as the desert willow, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a shrub or small tree that typically grows to a height of 2 to 6 meters, characterized by its woody stems and compound leaves. The plant produces clusters of fragrant, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink, which attract pollinators such as bees and hummingbirds. It is well adapted to drought conditions, with deep roots and a high tolerance for heat and poor soil. Kosteletzkya adenosiphon plays an important ecological role in desert ecosystems by providing food and habitat for various wildlife species.
